gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Transparency
Class TranslationOverlay

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Transparency.OverlayJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Transparency.TranslationOverlay
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IOverlay, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class TranslationOverlay
extends OverlayJPanel

This overlay is not like the Axis, Annotation, or Selection Overlays. Although it extends an OverlayJPanel, it is not used by view components. Instead it's primary purpose is for panning an image. This overlay will outline the "local bounds" of the image.

See Also:
TranslationJPanel, PanViewControl, XOR_PanCursor, Serialized Form

Field Detail

TRANSLATION_JPANEL

public static final java.lang.String TRANSLATION_JPANEL
"TranslationJPanel" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the TranslationJPanel. Since all of the state info needed by this overlay is contained in the TranslationJPanel ObjectState, this value is of type ObjectState, and contains the state of the overlay.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

TranslationOverlay

public TranslationOverlay()
Constructor - this will only initialize the local and global bounds. To actually set these values, use the setLocalBounds() and setGlobalBounds() methods.

TranslationOverlay

public TranslationOverlay(ObjectState state)
Constructor - this will call the default constructor before setting state information.

Method Detail

help

public static void help()
This method will be used to display help information about this overlay. It should open it's own JFrame with information about the overlay.

enableStretch

public void enableStretch(boolean can_stretch)
Use this method to enable/disable the stretching ability of the viewport.

Parameters:
can_stretch - True to enable stretching, false to disable.

isStretchEnabled

public boolean isStretchEnabled()
Use this method to find out if stretching is enabled.

Returns:
True is enabled, false if disabled.

getLocalBounds

public CoordBounds getLocalBounds()
Get the viewport or local bounds viewable to the user.

Returns:
viewport - viewable area

setLocalBounds

public void setLocalBounds(CoordBounds vp)
Set the size of the viewport. This method must be called whenever the local bounds of the CoordJPanel are changed. Also call this method to initialize a viewport size.

Parameters:
vp - CoordBounds representing the viewable area.

getGlobalBounds

public CoordBounds getGlobalBounds()
Set the size of the whole image. This size is usually going to be larger than the viewport.

Returns:
CoordBounds representing the total possible viewable area.

setGlobalBounds

public void setGlobalBounds(CoordBounds global)
Set the size of the whole image. This size is usually going to be larger than the viewport.

Parameters:
global - CoordBounds representing the total possible viewable area.

getFocus

public void getFocus()
This method requests window focus for the overlay. If focus is wanted by a private data member of an overlay, this method should be overloaded to have the data member itself call requestFocus().

Specified by:
getFocus in interface IOverlay
Overrides:

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
This method will get the current values of the state variables for this object. These variables will be wrapped in an ObjectState.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Specified by:
getObjectState in class OverlayJPanel
Parameters:
isDefault - Should selective state be returned, that used to store user preferences common from project to project?
Returns:
if true, the default state containing user preferences, if false, the entire state, suitable for project specific saves.

kill

public void kill()
This method is called by to inform the overlay that it is no longer needed. In turn, the overlay closes all windows created by it before closing.

Specified by:
kill in class OverlayJPanel
